repository.corpname: Archives & Special Collections at the Thomas J. Dodd Research Center, University of Connecticut Libraries

did.abstract: Born and raised in London, poet Tom Raworth travelled and worked in the United States and Mexico in the 1970s, returning to England in 1977 to be Resident Poet at King's College, Cambridge, the city in which he still lives. Since 1966 he has published more than forty books and pamphlets of poetry, prose and translations, in several countries. He was editor of three literary/art magazines: outburst (1961-63); Before Your Very Eyes! (1964); and Infolio (1986-87). During the 1960s he also ran two small presses - Matrix and Goliard. Since the early 1970s he has read his work in more than 20 countries.

bioghist.head: Biography
bioghist.p: Tom Raworth was born and grew up in London. During the 1970s he travelled and worked in the United States and Mexico, returning to England in 1977 to be Resident Poet at King's College, Cambridge, in which city he still lives. Since 1966 he has published more than forty books and pamphlets of poetry, prose and translations, in several countries. His graphic work has been shown in France, Italy, and the USA, and he has collaborated and performed with musicians, painters, and other poets.

He was editor of three literary/art magazines: outburst (1961-63); Before Your Very Eyes! (1964); and Infolio (1986-87). During the 1960s he also ran two small presses - Matrix and Goliard. Since the early 1970s he has read his work in more than 20 countries, including at many International Literary Festivals, and has been invited to teach, or to be a visiting writer, in France, Italy, the USA, and the Republic of South Africa.
Tom Raworth's Collected Poems were published in 2003. His latest collection is Windmills in Flames: Old and New Poems (2010).

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Item description, #:#], Tom Raworth Papers. Archives & Special Collections at the Thomas J. Dodd Research Center, University of Connecticut Libraries.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The collection contains literary manuscripts, notebooks, correspondence received by Raworth, personal notes and fragments of writings, galleys, and some photographs. The bulk of the collection dates from 1972 to 1977.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The collection is open and available for research.

userestrict.head: Copyright Information
userestrict.p: Permission to publish from these Papers must be obtained in writing from both the University of Connecticut Libraries and the owner(s) of the copyright.

acqinfo.head: Provenance and Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Acquired from Tom Raworth in 1974, 1976 and 1977.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: A substantial amount of Raworth correspondence resides in the Ed Dorn Papers and Charles Olson Research Collection in Archives and Special Collections at the Thomas J. Dodd Research Center. For detailed information on these collections please contact the curator or ask at the Reading Room desk.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: See also correspondence from Ed Dorn to Raworth, 1960 to 1972, in Boxes 8 and 9.
